content.description: The back of the Mollusk boulder is littered with a large amount of holds, most being very positive. There are many variations that exist. Traversing from left to right (and back again as much as you please) is a great way to get warm on some great feeling holds.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter if you're going to top it out
content.location: On the back of the Mollusk boulder

content.description: Follow the very obvious line that goes along the slopey scoop on the right side of the boulder. The classic warm-up of the Holies.
content.location: Right side of the Mollusk boulder

content.description: You'll have lots of options to go up and down the rails that run this side of the boulder, but a lot of the holds are junk. Give it a feel before jumping on. Good warm-up.
content.location: Start on Lowrider and traverse right. Topout up the crack at the end. Have a spotter to drag your pad, and to keep you from hitting the tree if you fall off the topout.

content.description: Sit start on some bad feet and a sloping crimp in the middle of the boulder. Make a strong move up to jugs for an easy topout. The V1 next to con artist was perviously misnamed as “El Pinto.”
content.location: This problem is on the right side of the boulder directly behind you as you’re looking at the mollusk.

content.description: Sit start on great jug and okay feet. Follow obvious jugs. Great sloper to left of the small crack and a good lefthand sidepole on the left edge make for a clean topout.
content.location: SW corner of boulder. Sit start hand-matched on great jug.

content.description: Start on your choice of very poor slopey slot crimps and head straight up the short slabby face. Hard move off bad left hand crimp. Deceivingly hard. Selected quotes: "Oh, that'll go next go for sure." "That was so close!" "Maybe next trip..."
content.protection: 1-2 pads, a spotter isn't really necessary but may help

content.description: start on horizontal finger cracks at chest high to the left of con artist, work straight up crimps on short problem. This was formerly mis-named as “El Pinto” , but it was an unnamed V1 from the comp.
The first boulder you will encounter when you enter the Holy Boulders. Will have the obvious trademark slopy scoop feature on the right side of the boulder.
